thread.title: Jones, Sharks beat Devils in shootout to remain unbeaten
thread.title_full: Jones, Sharks beat Devils in shootout to remain unbeaten

title: Jones, Sharks beat Devils in shootout to remain unbeaten
text:
Martin Jones posts fourth straight win as Sharks beat winless Devils 2-1 in shootout By TOM CANAVAN AP Sports Writer   9:58   9:58   
People: 
Men's sports (2326) 

NEWARK, New Jersey â€” Joe Pavelski and Brent Burns scored in the shootout and the San Jose Sharks rode another big effort by goaltender Martin Jones in posting a 2-1 victory over the winless New Jersey Devils on Friday night. 
Jones stopped 31 shots and came within 3:38 of posting his third straight shutout as the Sharks posted their fourth straight win under former New Jersey coach Pete DeBoer. They also kept the Devils winless at 0-3-1 under new coach John Hynes. 
DeBoer, who was fired by the Devils last season, is now 4-0 with San Jose. 
Patrick Marleau scored for the Sharks in the opening minute and the goal stood until Adam Henrique tied the game on a power play with 3:38 to play in regulation. 
Henrique scored for New Jersey on its first shootout attempt but Jacob Josefson was stopped on the second and Mike Cammalleri missed the net on the third.
